channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Qualcomm AI Research on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: An Information Theoretic Perspective on Conformal Prediction
item.description: This paper uses information theory to improve conformal prediction, proving new ways to bound uncertainty and creating better training methods and side-information incorporation.

item.title: FouRA: Fourier Low-Rank Adaptation
item.description: FouRA: a novel low-rank adaptation method improves text-to-image generation by learning projections in the Fourier domain and using an adaptive rank selection strategy, addressing LoRA’s limitations o…

item.title: Hollowed Net for On-Device Personalization of Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
item.description: Hollowed Net efficiently personalizes text-to-image diffusion models on-device by temporarily removing deep U-Net layers during training, drastically reducing memory usage without sacrificing performa…

item.title: On Sampling Strategies for Spectral Model Sharding
item.description: Two novel sampling strategies for spectral model sharding in federated learning minimize approximation error and create unbiased estimators, improving performance on various datasets.

item.title: Stepping Forward on the Last Mile
item.description: On-device training with fixed-point forward gradients enables efficient model personalization on resource-constrained edge devices, overcoming backpropagation’s memory limitations.
